briefTitle: STABIL Study: National Study With Mircera for Maintenance of Hemoglobin Level in Dialysis Patients
officialTitle: A Single Arm, Open Label Study to Assess the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Once-monthly Administration of Intravenous C.E.R.A. for the Maintenance of Haemoglobin Levels in Dialysis Patients With Chronic Renal Anaemia
summary: This single arm study will assess the efficacy, safety and tolerability of once-monthly administration of intravenous Mircera for the maintenance of hemoglobin levels in dialysis participants with chronic renal anemia. Participants will receive monthly intravenous injections of Mircera, at a starting dose of 120, 200 or 360 micrograms, according to the dose of epoetin administered in the week preceding first study drug administration. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Average Hemoglobin Concentration Within +/-1 Gram Per Deciliter (g/dL) of Reference and Within the Target Range
